column3: House lawmakers questioned TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew about potential Chinese government influence over the platform and promotion of misleading and harmful content.
Congress remains skeptical if TikTok can operate beyond the reach of the Chinese government considering ByteDance's ownership.
Biden administration recently demanded ByteDance to reduce stakes in TikTok or face a probable ban.
Congress is considering several bills to ban TikTok, including prohibiting US companies from doing business with the platform.
TikTok’s parent company shows different content to children in China, which could lead to privacy concerns and further scrutiny.
Banning TikTok could hurt Democrats more than Republicans, as TikTok’s audience includes younger people who are more likely to vote Democratic.
